shortdesc.ph: Configuration information for media stream relay across channels.
Configuration information for media stream relay across channels.

plentry.pd:
Source channel information , including the following members:
channelName: Name of the source channel. The default value is , which means the SDK populates the current channel name.
token: The token used to join the source channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in srcInfo.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value , indicating the SDK uses the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using channelName and uid, and the uid must be 0.
uid: The UID identifying the media stream to be relayed in the source channel. The default value is 0. Do not modify it.

pd.note: If the token of any destination channel expires, all cross-channel relays will stop. Therefore, it is recommended that you set the same expiration duration for all destination channel tokens.
pd.ph: Destination channel information , including the following members:

ul.li: channelName: Name of the destination channel.

token: The token used to join the destination channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in destInfos.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value , indicating the SDK uses the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using channelName and uid.

uid: The UID identifying the media stream to be relayed in the destination channel. The value range is [0, 2^32 - 1]. Ensure it is different from all UIDs in the destination channel. The default value is 0, which means the SDK randomly assigns a UID.

plentry.pd: Number of destination channels. The default value is 0. Value range: [0,6]. This parameter should match the number of objects defined in destInfos.

Source channel information , including the following members:
channelName: Name of the source channel. The default value is , which means the SDK fills in the current channel name.
token: The token used to join the source channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in srcInfo.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value , which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using the channelName and uid, and the uid must be 0.
uid: The UID that identifies the media stream being relayed in the source channel. The default value is 0. Do not modify it.

pd.note: Since token expiration in any destination channel will cause all cross-channel streaming to stop, it is recommended that you set the same expiration duration for tokens in all destination channels.
pd.ph: Destination channel information , including the following members:

ul.li: channelName: Name of the destination channel.

token: The token used to join the destination channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in destInfos.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value , which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using the channelName and uid.

uid: The UID that identifies the media stream being relayed in the destination channel. The value range is [0, 2^32-1]. Make sure it is different from all UIDs in the destination channel. The default value is 0, which means the SDK randomly assigns a UID.

plentry.pd: Number of destination channels. The default value is 0. Value range is [0,6]. This parameter should match the number of objects defined in destInfos.

Source channel information , which includes the following members:
channelName: Name of the source channel. Default is NULL, which means the SDK fills in the current channel name.
token: The token used to join the source channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in srcInfo.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value NULL, which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using the channelName and uid, and the uid must be 0.
uid: The UID that identifies the media stream being relayed in the source channel. Default is 0. Do not modify.

pd.note: If the token for any destination channel expires, all cross-channel relays will stop. Therefore, it is recommended that you set the same expiration duration for the tokens of all destination channels.
pd.ph: Destination channel information , which includes the following members:

ul.li: channelName: Name of the destination channel.

token: The token used to join the destination channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in destInfos.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value NULL, which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using the channelName and uid.

uid: The UID that identifies the media stream being relayed in the destination channel. The value range is 0 to (2^32 - 1). Ensure it is different from all UIDs in the destination channel. Default is 0, which means the SDK assigns a UID randomly.

plentry.pd: Number of destination channels. Default is 0. Value range is [0,6]. This parameter should match the number of objects defined in destInfos.

Source channel information , includes the following members:
channelName: Name of the source channel. Default is NULL, which means the SDK fills in the current channel name.
token: The token used to join the source channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in srcInfo.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value NULL, which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using channelName and uid, and the uid must be 0.
uid: UID identifying the media stream being relayed in the source channel. Default is 0. Do not modify.

pd.note: Because the expiration of the token in any target channel will cause all cross-channel streaming to stop, it is recommended that you set the same expiration duration for the tokens in all target channels.
pd.ph: Target channel information , includes the following members:

ul.li: channelName: Name of the target channel.

token: The token used to join the target channel. It is generated based on the channelName and uid you set in destInfos.
If App Certificate is not enabled, you can set this parameter to the default value NULL, which means the SDK fills in the App ID.
If App Certificate is enabled, you must provide a token generated using channelName and uid.

uid: UID identifying the media stream being relayed in the target channel. The value range is [0, 2^32 - 1]. Make sure it is different from all UIDs in the target channel. Default is 0, which means the SDK assigns a UID randomly.

plentry.pd: Number of target channels. Default is 0. Value range is [0,6]. This parameter should match the number of objects you define in destInfos.
